posts.title: Welcome - Using this Free Blog Template
posts.seo_description: How to set up the minimal JSON-powered blog template: folder structure, posts.json, and deployment tips.
posts.content:
# What this is

A lightweight, no-build blog. Posts live in **posts.json** and are rendered by the browser.

## Files
- `index.html` - list of posts
- `post.html` - single post
- `posts.json` - your content
- `styles.css` - theme variables
- `app.js` / `post.js` - logic

## How to add a post
1. Add an item to the `posts` array in `posts.json`.
2. Set a unique **title** and **date** (YYYY-MM-DD). The slug is built from `title-date`.
3. Optional: set **topic**, **image**, **seo_description**, **seo_keywords`**.

## Local testing
Use a simple server (e.g. `python -m http.server`) so `fetch('posts.json')` works.

## Deploying
Upload these files anywhere that serves static files (GitHub Pages, Netlify, etc.).

posts.title: Customize the Theme (Edit CSS Tokens)
posts.seo_description: Edit a few CSS variables to restyle colors, spacing, and typography.
posts.content:
# Quick theming via CSS variables

Open `styles.css` and edit the **THEME TOKENS** section at the top.

## Common edits
- **Colors**: `--bg`, `--text`, `--border`, `--accent`
- **Typography**: `--font-base`, `--size-h1`, `--size-h2`
- **Radius**: `--radius`, `--radius-pill`
- **Spacing**: `--space-*`

```css
:root{
  --bg:#ffffff; --text:#111111; --accent:#0ea5e9;
}
```

## Reader Mode
The **Easy Reader** button toggles `.reader-on`, which swaps to a high-contrast palette. Change those variables under the `.reader-on` block in `styles.css`.

## Cards & chips
Component styles are in clearly labeled sections so you can tweak borders, padding and font sizes without hunting around.

posts.title: Write Posts with Supported Markdown
posts.seo_description: What markdown is supported by the built-in parser, with examples.
posts.content:
# Supported markdown

This template uses a tiny parser, so keep it simple.

## Headings
Use `#` through `######`:

```
# H1
## H2
### H3
```

## Bold & italics
- **bold** with `**text**` or `__text__`
- *italic* with `*text*` or `_text_`

## Links
`[RandomBoo](https://randomboo.com/)`

## Lists
Start lines with `- ` or `* ` (unordered lists only):

- Item one
- Item two
- Item three

## Code
Inline `code` and fenced blocks:

```
console.log('hello');
```

## Images
`![Alt text](images/image.png)`

> Notes:
> - Ordered lists, blockquotes, and tables arenâ€™t parsed.
> - Separate paragraphs with a blank line.
> - Line breaks inside a paragraph are respected.
